subject: Critical Thinking
title: Treating People as Ends, Not Means
description: A micro-lesson that makes Treating People as Ends, Not Means usable.

hook.text: You hire someone just to impress a client. You date someone just to make your ex jealous. You're using people as tools.

buildup.text: Kant's second formulation: 'Treat humanity, in yourself and others, always as an end and never merely as a means.'

discovery.text: People have inherent dignity â€“ they're not instruments for your goals.

twist.text: 'Merely' is key: it's okay to use a taxi driver's services if you also respect them as a person.

climax.text: Slavery, exploitation, & manipulation all violate this: they reduce persons to tools.

punchline.text: People are not tools. They're not stepping stones. They're not means.

quiz.question: What does Kant mean by treating people as 'ends in themselves'?
options: Respecting their inherent dignity and autonomy, never using them merely as instruments
